comments.body:
Do we actually need this special casing at all? Seems to me that the below code could handle it by replacing

```python
flag = np.concatenate(([True], aux[1:] != aux[:-1]))
```
with
```python
flag = np.empty(aux.shape, dtype=np.bool)
flag[:1] = True
np.not_equal(aux[1:], aux[:-1], out=flag[1:])
# flag[1:] = aux[1:] != aux[:-1]  would work above too, but be slower
```
Which I would expect to be faster

You mean the block where arr.size == 0? Your suggestion is definitely more elegant, and it looks like it will work, but I'm not sure it would be faster per se, since there would not be less instructions executed if arr.size == 0, unless I'm missing something here. I guess it is also easier to read in its current form (but more effort to maintain).

I don't think speed is something we need to worry about for `size == 0` - there's definitely no reason to make that case faster than the other cases.

My remark about speed is regarding the normal use case
Ah ok, I suppose you are right. Should I just modify the current pull request, or will you merge this one, then I make a new pull request with this modification?
I guess I may as well merge this one first, since it's definitely correct, and is a nice and contained bugfix
Ok, sure. Should I make a separate issue for it too?
No need to file an issue for something that isn't a bug - just go straight to the PR
